p: All the researcher groups which analyzed the antiviral activity of chlorpromazine, fluphenazine, perphenazine, prochlorperazine, and thioridazine observed decrease viability of host cells after treatment. The summarized IC 50 values of the analyzed drugs towards different types of viruses were shown in Table 2 . In case of chlorpromazine towards MERS-CoV and HCoV-229E-GFP, prochlorperazine towards HCV, and thioridazine towards HCV and EBOV the obtained IC 50 and EC 50 values are lower than the upper range of toxic concentration observed in human plasma, which is up to 2 μg/ml (i.e. 5.63 μM), 0.1 μg/ml (i.e. 0.20 μM), 1 μg/ml (i.e. 2.47 μM), 1 μg/ml (i.e.1.65 μM), and 5 μg/ml (i.e.12.28 μM) for chlorpromazine, fluphenazine, perphenazine, and prochlorperazine, and thioridazine respectively ( Schulz and Schmoldt, 2003; Winek et al., 2001).
